perturbation.original_text: In accordance with Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby confirm the agreement by and among them to the joint filing on behalf of them of the Statement on Schedule 13D and any and all further amendments thereto, with respect to the securities of the above referenced issuer, and that this Agreement be included as an Exhibit to such filing.
perturbation.changed_text: In accordance with Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby confirm their intent to jointly file the Statement on Schedule 13D and any further amendments thereto, with respect to the securities of the above referenced issuer, and that this Agreement be included as an Exhibit to such filing, provided they deem it necessary.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'confirm the agreement...to the joint filing' with 'confirm their intent to jointly file...provided they deem it necessary' introduces ambiguity. The original text is a firm commitment, while the modified text makes the filing contingent on their own subjective assessment of necessity. This weakens the obligation to comply with SEC filing requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Section 13(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 13d-1(k) which mandate timely and accurate joint filings when parties act as a group.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts each of which shall be deemed to be an original and all of which together shall be deemed to constitute one and the same Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be executed in a number of counterparts if convenient, and each may be considered an original to the extent permissible, with the collective effect subject to further interpretation.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'any number of counterparts each of which shall be deemed to be an original and all of which together shall be deemed to constitute one and the same Agreement' to 'a number of counterparts if convenient, and each may be considered an original to the extent permissible, with the collective effect subject to further interpretation' creates ambiguity about the validity and enforceability of the agreement. Using 'if convenient', 'to the extent permissible', and 'subject to further interpretation' makes it unclear whether the counterparts are legally binding, particularly when combined. Original text makes it a single agreement no matter the number of counterpart
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles requiring clear agreement and certainty of terms for enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: In accordance with Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby confirm the agreement by and among them to the joint filing on behalf of them of the Statement on Schedule 13D and any and all further amendments thereto, with respect to the securities of the above referenced issuer, and that this Agreement be included as an Exhibit to such filing.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned acknowledge the potential requirement to jointly file a Statement on Schedule 13D and related amendments, if deemed appropriate by a majority of the parties involved, and to include this Agreement as an exhibit, subject to legal counsel's review.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'confirm the agreement by and among them to the joint filing' to 'acknowledge the potential requirement to jointly file...if deemed appropriate by a majority of the parties involved' and adding 'subject to legal counsel's review' creates ambiguity. It replaces a clear commitment to file with a conditional acknowledgment, dependent on the majority's subjective assessment and legal review. This undermines the mandatory nature of the filing requirement under Section 13(d).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Section 13(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 13d-1(k) which mandate timely and accurate joint filings when parties act as a group.
